automatic_ordering.reasoning: Almost all the sessions in this dataset are 'ShadowMemory' entries that share a nearly identical synopsis and no trigger information that would force an ordering with one another. Their numerical labels (e.g. ShadowMemory1, ShadowMemory2, etc.) do not come with explicit story cues that mandate a strict sequence; they are best viewed as flavor echoes without dependency. In contrast, the three Entrance_Plaque sessions do have differing triggering data and descriptions that allow us to infer a light ordering or exclusivity. In particular, Entrance_Plaque3 is described as a vertical clickable plaque activated via trigger 'SCL_Main_A59 -1166', whereas both Entrance_Plaque1 and Entrance_Plaque2 are rounded clickable plaques in the same location and share the same trigger 'SCL_Main_A75 -1166'. This suggests that Plaque3 is encountered under different circumstances (and likely earlier, given the different trigger code) while only one of Entrance_Plaque1 or Entrance_Plaque2 will be activated in a given playthrough (since they are identical in function and trigger). Thus, we infer that Entrance_Plaque3 should come before either Entrance_Plaque1 or Entrance_Plaque2 (which are mutually exclusive with each other).

ShadowMemory4_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory4_0.text: *You sense a fading echo of the person who once was. A dockhand. He did not ask for this.*

ShadowMemory20_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory20_0.text: *A distant memory of a man stretching his back with a groan. Another day of hauling masonry blocks done...*

ShadowMemory8_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory8_0.text: *She was a healer, trying to aid the wounded in the battle against the Sharrans. But there were so many...*

ShadowMemory16_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory16_0.text: *You sense a matriarch's flush of pride - she will soon be a grandmother, and the child will bear her name. Muldred.*

Entrance_Plaque3_0.speaker: Narrator
Entrance_Plaque3_0.text: *We offer ourselves to the darkness, that blessed Shar may give us her mercy.*

ShadowMemory17_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory17_0.text: *Callused hands work a hammer and chisel around a massive slab of rock. Months from now, a face will take shape.*

Entrance_Plaque2_0.speaker: Narrator
Entrance_Plaque2_0.text: *We offer our pain to the Lady of Loss, that she may truly know her faithful.*

ShadowMemory9_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory9_0.text: *You see a man stalking slowly through the woods, bow half-drawn. If he bags a deer, the whole family will be kept fed all winter...*

ShadowMemory21_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory21_0.text: *You can almost taste the sour ale that once clung to this soul's breath. He was insensible when the shadows came for him.*

ShadowMemory5_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory5_0.text: *You glimpse a young Harper on the eve of battle against Thorm, long ago. He and his comrades toast each other in Last Light...*

ShadowMemory10_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory10_0.text: *In her former life, this girl played in the nearby woods. She was always the best at climbing trees.*

ShadowMemory2_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory2_0.text: *You can almost feel the heat from the forge. This one was once a blacksmith.*

ShadowMemory26_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory26_0.text: *You sense a faded memory of marching in an army against Ketheric Thorm. Victory seemed possible then.*

ShadowMemory30_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory30_0.text: *An echo of the past shows a man hunched over a ledger, quill in hand. Tolls collected on the Risen Road, destined for Moonrise.*

ShadowMemory31_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory31_0.text: *You see a man drain his tankard in an inn as he listens to a Flaming Fist play the lute. He's better than his uniform might suggest.*

ShadowMemory31_2.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory31_2.text: *You catch a glimpse of the lute-playing Flaming Fist. It's the catatonic man you encountered in Last Light Inn.*

ShadowMemory27_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory27_0.text: *You can almost smell the hops and barley for yourself. This man's family always complained that his clothing reeked after work at the brewery.*

ShadowMemory3_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory3_0.text: *Desperate prayers to Selûne, echoing from the past. They did not save him.*

ShadowMemory11_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory11_0.text: *You see an older woman, on her knees, scrubbing the floor of an inn. The patrons made a mess of things again the night before.*

ShadowMemory28_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory28_0.text: *You hear the heavy thud of a butcher's cleaver on his block, as he divides his meagre fare for those waiting. Never enough to go around.*

ShadowMemory12_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory12_0.text: *He had dreams of boarding a ship in Baldur's Gate, and seeing the world. But then the darkness came.*

ShadowMemory32_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory32_0.text: *An older man turns his head away in shame. His neighbours would not renounce Selûne - now they hang in the town square.*

ShadowMemory24_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory24_0.text: *A strange feeling of resentment comes to you. A travelling merchant, sick of this route. Sick of the tolls eating away his profits.*

ShadowMemory1_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory1_0.text: *A faded memory of a boy and girl sharing their first kiss. Your own heart almost flutters in tune with theirs.*

ShadowMemory25_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory25_0.text: *You see an old boot, balanced upside down on a cobbler's knee, as he taps the final nail into the new sole. Good as new.*

ShadowMemory33_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory33_0.text: *You feel a rush of outrage. This woman worshipped Shar to the end - so why does the Nightsinger's curse not spare her...?*

ShadowMemory13_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory13_0.text: *You sense a young woman, gazing at Moonrise Towers in awe. Perhaps one day she will get to gaze out from atop it, she hopes.*

ShadowMemory29_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory29_0.text: *You see a mother sitting by her child's bedside, listening to his sickly breathing as he sleeps.*

ShadowMemory22_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory22_0.text: *A happy, faded memory comes to you. A woman walking along a beach, holding hands with her husband-to-be.*

ShadowMemory6_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory6_0.text: *Thoughts of baby names. She did not wish for her first born to be named after her mother-in-law. Muldred. Ugh.*

ShadowMemory18_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory18_0.text: *You sense this one hid for days as the sounds of battle got closer and closer to town. You didn't even care who won, so long as it ended.*

ShadowMemory14_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory14_0.text: *The image of an orange-haired cat asleep before a fireplace comes to you. What came of it?*

Entrance_Plaque1_0.speaker: Narrator
Entrance_Plaque1_0.text: *We offer our prayers to the Dark Lady, whose comfort and grace heals all.*

ShadowMemory15_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory15_0.text: *You sense a swell of grief. Before the shadows took her, this woman mourned someone lost in battle.*

ShadowMemory19_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory19_0.text: *Before the shadows, there was once a house full of warmth a childrens' laughter in this one's life. No more.*

ShadowMemory7_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory7_0.text: *You sense that this one was once a fisherman, taught by his father.*

ShadowMemory23_0.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory23_0.text: *As the pile of sawdust on the floor grows larger, the cabinet gradually takes shape. The carpenter's pride washes over you...*
